explain: The given aspect is about a speed camera in Birmingham, UK that has been re-aimed after being non-functional for two years.

"The camera was turned off in 2013 and replaced with mobile and motorway units" is an aspect of the given summary. This means that a fixed speed camera named Gatso, which was previously used to enforce a 30mph limit along a residential road in Handsworth, Birmingham, was shut down in 2013. The reason behind this was the belief that it was no longer effective in reducing speeding and accidents in the area. Instead, mobile and motorway cameras were introduced to replace the functions of the disabled Gatso camera.

This aspect talks about the mystery surrounding who re-aimed the camera that was previously enforcing the 30mph speed limit for motorists along the residential road in Handsworth, Birmingham. It could be removed by someone unknown, leaving the authorities clueless about their action.

The technology inside the fixed cameras had become obsolete means that the devices were no longer functional due to being outdated, and unable to accommodate updated software or hardware requirements. As a result, they were turned off, as they were not meeting the needs of the intended purpose.
The new digital technology for monitoring and enforcing speed limits on motorists is currently being piloted and developed in the West Midlands.

The aspect states that the camera, which was previously enforcing the 30mph speed limit for motorists along the residential road in Handsworth, Birmingham, will not be included in the pilot project to improve road safety. The two-year-old camera has been turned off and will not be used to monitor the road's speed limit for the duration of the pilot.

The owners of the house were not available for comment may indicate that the residents were not consulted or informed about the decision to turn off the speed cameras, and thus, they have no opinion or response to share on the matter. The absence of their comments could symbolize a lack of involvement, ownership, or concern for the issue.
